page.title: 11Pipeline Through Emborough
page.content: In the early part of 1985 the area was, in common with other parts of the south west, invaded by any army of workmen with heavy digging equipment. A project was mounted by the Gas Authority which consisted of the laying of an underground line to carry a secondary supply of gas in huge pipes right across the countryside and under roads. Farmers, landowners nd tenants were compensated for the disturbance of the land/or loss of crops nd when the pipes were in place the Authority re-instated the field etc. that they had crossed. However, in spite of the fact that there is now a supply of gas beneath their feet the people of the area remain, as before, without this amenity.
